item.title: Two dead and hundreds arrested in France after PSG win soccer Champions League

item.title: At least seven dead after two Russian bridges collapse
item.description: Russia's Investigative Committee, the country's top criminal investigation agency, said in a statement that explosions had caused the two bridges to collapse, but did not give further details.

item.title: The White House is deporting people to countries they're not from. Why?
item.description: The administration argues the men's home countries won't take them — but lawyers say getting sent to a country like South Sudan could lead to more persecution.

item.title: North Carolina had a housing crisis before Hurricane Helene; now it's even worse
item.description: Hurricanes have gotten larger and wetter because of climate change and inland communities are at greater risk from heavy flooding. That's what Hurricane Helene did to western North Carolina last year.

item.title: Iranian FM stresses cooperation after watchdog report on rising uranium stockpile
item.description: A classified UN report found that Iran has sharply increased its uranium stockpile since February. This comes just as the U.S. prepares for renewed nuclear talks with Tehran.

item.title: Hamas seeks changes to Gaza ceasefire proposal but US envoy calls it 'unacceptable'
item.description: Hamas said it was seeking last minute changes to a 60-day ceasefire plan backed by the U.S. and approved by Israel. U.S. envoy Steve Witkoff dismissed the changes as "totally unacceptable."

item.title: The Indiana Pacers and Oklahoma City Thunder will meet in the NBA Finals
item.description: It would be the first NBA title for either of the two energetic fan bases and their exciting young teams. The Thunder, led by newly minted league MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, is the early favorite.
